document_title: What is infertility? Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_content:
Infertility according to the definition of the World Health Organization (WHO) is a condition in which a couple lives together and has regular sexual intercourse without using any contraceptive method but after 1 year (with the wife under 35 years old) and after 6 months (with wife over 35 years old) but still not pregnant naturally.
The Asia-Pacific region is the region with the lowest fertility and highest infertility rates. This trend is increasing the number of women who are having fewer and fewer children, delaying the age of childbearing or not having children at all. (first)
In Vietnam, the birth rate has been steadily decreasing for two decades. According to some studies in 8 provinces representing 8 ecological regions of our country, there are from 700,000 to 1 million couples experiencing infertility.
